citation.article-title: Flavobacterium sinopsychrotolerans sp. nov., isolated from a glacier
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Flavobacterium sinopsychrotolerans sp. nov.

Flavobacterium sinopsychrotolerans (si′no.psy.chro.to′ler.ans. M.L. gen. n. sinae of China; Gr. adj. psychros cold; L. part. adj. tolerans tolerating; N.L. part. adj. sinopsychrotolerans Chinese and cold-tolerating).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-flagellated, non-gliding, aerobic rods, 0.3–0.4 μm wide and 1.7–4.3 μm long.
Colonies are yellow, circular, convex and smooth with entire margins.
Grows on PYG agar, nutrient agar and trypticase soy agar, but not on marine agar.
Grows at 4–25 °C (optimum 21–22 °C), at pH 6.5–10.0 (optimum pH 7.0–7.5) and with 0–2.0 % NaCl (optimum 0.5 % NaCl).
Anaerobic growth (<1 % O2, 9–13 % CO2) is not observed on PYG agar.
Oxidase- and catalase- positive.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
Casein, aesculin, starch and Tween 60 are hydrolysed, but urea, gelatin, tyrosine, chitin, alginate, DNA, CM-cellulose and Tweens 20 and 80 are not.
Flexirubin-type pigments are not produced and Congo red is not absorbed.
No precipitate is formed on egg yolk agar.
Negative for hydrogen sulfide and indole production and Voges–Proskauer reaction.

Utilizes fructose, d-glucose, maltose, sucrose and l-glutamic acid, but not l-arabinose, cellobiose, galactose, lactose, mannose, melezitose, melibiose, raffinose, rhamnose, ribose, sorbose, trehalose, xylose, adonitol, erythritol, glycerol, mannitol, sorbitol, acetic acid, aspartic acid, citric acid, lactic acid, malonic acid, pyruvate, succinate, tartrate, inulin or glycogen.

Produces acid from fructose, d-glucose, maltose, mannose and starch, but not from l-arabinose, cellobiose, galactose, lactose, melezitose, melibiose, raffinose, rhamnose, ribose, sorbose, sucrose, trehalose, xylose, adonitol, glycerol, mannitol, sorbitol, methyl α-d-glucoside, meso-erythritol, amygdalin, heparin, inulin or salicin.
Negative for glucose fermentation, indole production and arginine dihydrolase activity.

With API 20NE, positive for assimilation of d-glucose, maltose and N-acetylglucosamine, but negative for assimilation of l-arabinose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, potassium gluconate, adipic acid, capric acid, malic acid, trisodium citrate and phenylacetic acid.
With API 20E, arginine dihydrolase, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase and tryptophan deaminase activities are absent.

With API ZYM, acid phosphatase, alkaline phosphatase, esterase lipase (C8), cystine arylamidase, leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase activities are present, but esterase (C4), lipase (C14), α-fucosidase, β-fucosidase, β-galactosidase and α-mannosidase activities are absent.
Menaquinone 6 (MK-6) is the major respiratory quinone.

The predominant fatty acids (>5 %) are iso-C15 : 0, C17 : 1ω6c, anteiso-C15 : 0, iso-C15 : 0 3-OH, C15 : 1ω6c, iso-C16 : 0 3-OH, summed feature 3 (comprising C16 : 1ω7c and/or C16 : 1ω6c), iso-C15 : 1 G and iso-C17 : 0 3-OH.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 32.5 mol%.
The type strain is 0533T (=CGMCC 1.8704T =JCM 16398T), isolated from the China No. 1 glacier (Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region, China).
